direction.raw_text: You better, because when I vouch for someone, it's my word and I don't want anyone making me look bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm good. I'm totally into this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And don't lay down to people all the time. Always look a person in the eye. When you shake a man's hand, you can usually tell where you stand with him. Walt hands a pair of beat-up WORK GLOVES to Tao.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, stuff these in your back pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just don't blow this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAGE 87 Walt and Tao walk up to the Superintendent's Office Trailer on a construction job site.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walt and Tao come in. Walt shakes hands with TIM KENNEDY, the job super.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kennedy, you drunken Irish goon, how the hell are ya?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shitty, but who's gonna listen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not me. Walt pours himself a cup of the bad job-site coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help yourself, Walt, you dumb Pollack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I already did. This is the kid I told you about. Tao, this is Tim Kennedy, he's the super on the job. Kennedy looks Tao up and down. Tao looks him in the eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do we got, Walt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's done construction here and there. Whatever you need, he'll pick it up quick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You speak English?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You born here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAGE 88 TAO You bet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a vehicle? I see Walt drove you here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not at the moment. I'm taking the bus for now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bus? Jesus Christ, you don't have a car?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My headgasket cracked and the goddamned prick at the shop wants to bend me over for $2100.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just replaced the tranny in my Tahoe and the sons a bitches fucked me hard, just under $3200.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddamned thieves. It ain't right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got that right. Come on in on Monday and we'll find something for you to do. Tao puts out his hand to shake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Mr. Kennedy. Tim Kennedy shakes Tao's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Tim. What's your name again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tao.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. You owe me one, Walt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll send you a fucking fruitcake at Christmas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAGE 89 KENNEDY Fuck the fruitcake, why don't you hand over the keys to that Gran Torino.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, everybody seems to want that car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know the half of it. Come on, zipper head, let's let this big Mick get back to screwing off. Walt and Tao exit and walk back to the truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walt pulls into a Home Depot parking lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are we doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you gonna put all your tools in, an empty rice bag?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walt and Tao walk the aisles. Walt grabs a tool belt and tosses it to Tao.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll need this. Walt then tosses Tao a utility knife holder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you'll need that. Now where the hell do they hide the hardware holders?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't afford any of this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll get it, but you're paying me back with your first check.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAGE 90 TAO Cool. Walt pitches a hardware pouch at Tao.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you need this too. That should about do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not to bitch, but won't I be needing some tools?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tools I got, but I ain't loaning you my tool belt. You can buy tools as you go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I appreciate all this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, forget it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I really do. Thank you. Walt sticks out his jaw and looks Tao straight in the eye. Tao doesn't know what to expect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Walt puts out his HAND to Tao. Tao extends his and they SHAKE HANDS. It's really quite a moment for both of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tao gets off the bus, his tool belt over his shoulder. Tao looks tired after working, but content. He walks past an abandoned lot. The tricked-out Honda pulls up and stops. Smokie, Spider and company get out. Tao looks nervous, but remains calm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just seeing what you're up to, cuz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAGE 91 TAO I'm getting home from work, not that you guys would know much about that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So it's true? You got a job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, what do you guys want with me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ, Tao. What do you think? I've been sooooo easy on you, but I can't just go on like nothing happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't just leave me alone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Afraid not. The gangbangers grab Tao. Tao kicks and struggles as they yank away his tool belt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep your hands off my stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your stuff? You and everything you have is mine. I own you. Smokie pulls the tape measure off the belt and smashes it against the pavement. Whatever tools Smokie can't destroy, he tosses onto the roof of the closest building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't just walk away from us, Tao. It looks bad. It makes me look bad. Smokie lights a CIGARETTE and exhales...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the phrase I'm looking for? Oh yeah, I need to save face.' Smokie grabs Tao by the neck and presses the lit
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: into Tao's cheek. Tao screams as his flesh burns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WALT'S ALLEY - MORNING 83 83 Walt spots Tao as he takes out the trash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey there. Tao looks to the ground and heads in the other direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I gotta run.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a minute. Where have you been, I haven't seen you in days?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Busy. Walt squints at Tao. He steps closer. Tao looks away. Walt tilts Tao's head up, he sees the burn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What in the hell happened to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry about it? Look at your goddamned face!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said don't worry about it. It's not your problem. Walt looks at the ground and spits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Couple days ago. Grabbed me after I got off the bus coming home from work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cowards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did everything I could possibly do. They broke some of your tools. I'll replace them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget the tools. Where does your cousin live?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Walt, I can manage. I don't want you doing anything. Walt is angry, but eventually nods at Tao.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright. You need any other tools for work?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could use a roofing hammer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go in the garage and get whatever you need.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tao leans over his desk with a black Sharpie marker. He carefully writes Tao Vang Lor in black ink on the face of his smashed-up tape measure. He puts it back into the tool belt and grabs another tool to label.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walt sits in the dark, the only light is from the radio tuned to baseball. Daisy lies in the front seat. Next to Daisy is the M1 RIFLE. Walt watches as Spider and another Hmong gangbanger step out of the rundown duplex, get in their Honda and drive off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the last of them. Walt pulls out his Colt .45 automatic and chambers a round.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walt pounds loudly on the door. A moment later the door starts to swing open and a voice is heard...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) What the hell did...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAGE 94 Walt kicks open the door and grabs Smokie by the collar. Walt drags the 105 pound Smokie out of his house and tosses him off the front porch onto the front sidewalk. Smokie is stunned. Walt kicks him hard in the ribs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How the fuck did you get here?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You aren't that hard to track down. Walt boots him again. Smokie curls up in the fetal position.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want? Walt kicks him a second time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came to give you a chance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: comes out of the shadows under the porch. Walt swings the barrel of the big Colt .45 at the movement. It's a cat. Walt puts his pistol away. Smokie exhales.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just you and me. Nobody knows or has to know I was here. You lay off Tao. Tell your guys he ain't worth it or whatever the hell you want. You don't talk to him, you don't go near him. This is your one chance. You lay off and no one will ever be the wiser. Smokie says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll take that as a yes. I don't want to come back here. But if I do, believe me, it'll be goddamned ugly. Walt kicks Smokie again and stalks off into the dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WALT'S HOUSE - SAME EVENING 87 87 Walt pulls up his driveway and parks. Daisy jumps out and Walt carries his rifle into the house. Walt walks stiffly. Walt gets to the door and drops his keys. When he bends down to pick them up, you can really tell he's sore and hurting. Walt groans as he goes inside. He's feeling his age.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vu, Sue, Tao and Wa Xam all sit in lawn chairs, talking and laughing. Walt flips the inch-thick STEAKS on his Weber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you want your dog... I mean steaks cooked? Medium, medium well?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Funny. Walt pops open a beer and grabs an appetizer that Vu made.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this Hmoog or Laab?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laab.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't it usually a little spicier? Tao, Wa Xam and Sue laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh whatever, Wally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It does. Usually it's got more zing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ, look at you. I've never seen you like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at you smile, old man. Kicking back, having a good old time. You're sure pleased with yourself today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And it's a little unnerving if you ask me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, go on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, admit it. You are. You're feeling pretty good, aren't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, who wouldn't? I'm surrounded by beautiful women, it's a beautiful day. Great food, good friends. Hell, even Toad isn't driving me nuts for once.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It never ends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just kidding. Let me tell you something, Yum-Yum. If Tao doesn't ask you out soon, I will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't listen to him, Wa Xam. He's a white devil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd love to, Walt, but he beat you to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be damned. Movie? Dinner? Wa Xam and Tao nod. They're a bit embarrassed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, they're taking the bus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bus?! That's no good. A charming young lady like this deserves to go in style.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAGE 97 TAO Like what? Take a limo? Walt nods towards the GRAN TORINO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Gran Torino? You'd let me drive it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Why not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? Walt smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really. They shake hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walt watches baseball. He hears a car outside. Shouts are heard and glass breaks. Walt gets up and looks out the shades...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is raked with GUNFIRE coming from a VAN! Windows shatter and the siding splinters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shake the house before the VAN peels off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walt is up their front steps and in the house in seconds. Walt goes from room to room, from Vu to Phong finally to Tao -- making sure no one's been hit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is everyone okay? Is anyone hit? Sue? Vu? Tao, where's Tao? Tao sits up from behind the couch. Blood pours down his neck. He's stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh no. Walt lays Tao down and rips open the collar of his shirt. Walt probes around Tao's neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAGE 98 TAO What... what is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hang on... you're just cut, is all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is everybody else okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Walt looks around at the BULLET HOLES in the walls. Tao follows his gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a miracle no one was killed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They aimed high. Sure enough -- most of the bullet holes are above head level on the walls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Sue?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She went to our aunt's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said call her. Get the goddamned phone and call and see if she's there. Tao scrambles for the phone and dials. Tao speaks Hmong to whomever answered. Tao starts to speak faster. He looks at Walt and shakes his head no. For once -- Vu and Phong understand what Walt was talking about. There is anguish on every face in the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TAO'S HOUSE - LATER 91 91 Walt sits across from Tao, drinking rice liquor. Walt speaks loudly, without any consideration for Phong who shoots him dirty looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is exactly what I didn't want. Damn gooks. Why the hell am I even here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe one of her friends called and she just changed plans. Walt sips the rice liquor. Walt now speaks quietly to Tao.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: -- SUE WALKS IN LIKE A ZOMBIE

direction.raw_text: In Korea I learned not to care. The best friends of my life are still missing somewhere in Korea. You harden yourself. Don't let anything get to you. Phong looks out the window and screams. She runs over and swings open the door. Everyone expects the worst... And it comes like a cold wind -- SUE WALKS IN LIKE A ZOMBIE. She has been brutally beaten. Her clothes are dirty and torn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: runs down SUE'S legs from under her shirt. Walt looks at her and the glass falls from his hand. Sue staggers into Vu's arms. Vu weeps. Sue hugs her mother and sobs. Tao reaches to hug his sister, but Phong screeches at him, pointing at Walt and back to Tao. Walt is destroyed. He steps outside into the dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walt staggers across the yard to his house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, no, no, no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walt bursts in the door, throws himself in an easy chair and CRIES. He tries to stop and cries harder. It's the first time Walt has cried in fifty years. He wails, crying for Tao, Sue, his wife, kids and himself. He lets it all out. Daisy jumps in his lap and he hugs his old dog as he bawls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walt sits, red-eyed. He's done crying. Family photo albums are scattered around. Father Janovich knocks and eases open the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Kowalski, are you in here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on in. Father Janovich comes in and sits down across from Walt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay? Walt nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The police finally left. No one is talking. One thing about the Hmong, they keep their mouths shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've noticed that. Father Janovich picks up a photo album and flips through it. Pictures of Mitch and Steve as babies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, there's no way that Tao or Sue are gonna have any peace if these gang guys don't go away. Go away forever. You know it as well as I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you saying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAGE 101 WALT You heard what I said.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They took Sue to the hospital. She's scared. They're all scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know that. Believe me, they all know that. Tao especially. He's sitting out there staring at your front door. You know what he expects, Mr. Kowalski.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well what would you do if you were me? If you were Tao? What would you do? Father Janovich shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what I'd do if I was you, or at least what you think you should do. If I was Tao I guess I'd want vengeance. I'd want to stand shoulder to shoulder with you and kill those guys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What would I do? I'd come over here and talk to you I guess. I know you're close with these people, but this pisses me off too, Mr. Kowalski. Walt nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wanna beer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd love one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're in the cooler, grab me one too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAGE 102 Father Janovich grabs four beers, two for each of them. He opens a Pabst and takes a big swig.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn all this. It just isn't fair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing's fair, Father. Father Janovich and Walt sit for awhile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, what are you going to do, Mr. Kowalski?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call me Walt. Father Janovich nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, what are you going to do, Walt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not sure yet. All I do know is they don't have a goddamned chance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walt sits at the kitchen table in his robe, drinking coffee. Tao comes in without even knocking on the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm thinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thinking time is over. Now it's time to knock the ass out of those pricks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you don't want to hear this, but you have to calm down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAGE 103 WALT You have to have a clear head, otherwise mistakes get made. Back away from what's happened, Tao.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Don't let me down, Walt. Not you. This is going to end, today. Walt stands up and pulls out a chair for Tao to sit in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to sit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Just listen up for a second and don't say anything. Tao sits down. Walt rubs his hands together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what needs to be done. I need to prepare, this needs to be carefully planned. You know I'm the right man for this. So cool down for a little while and meet me back here at 4 P.M. I promise you, what needs to be done, will be done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I say we go now. Right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And do what? You want to go kill your cousin and those other Zips. Mr. Tough-Guy-All-Of-A-Sudden is out for blood. What do you even know about it? Tao is furious, but says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trust me, Tao. Cool down and we'll meet back here at four. Okay? Tao doesn't answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAGE 104 WALT I said okay?' You won't do anything without me. You meet me back here at four? Say okay.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Tao storms out the back door. Walt pours more coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walt soaks in the tub. It's filled with bubbles. Walt looks over at Daisy who rests on a towel in the corner. Walt lights a CIGARETTE and exhales. Daisy curls up her lips at the smoke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, I know. Give me a break, it's the first time I've ever smoked in the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walt meticulously mows his lawn. He carefully trims around the fence and birdbath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin finishes cutting Walt's hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There, all done. Ten bucks American.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't suppose you still have steady enough hands to give a guy a straight shave, you withered, old Italian mummy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You? A straight shave? You've never ordered a straight shave, ever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right. I always wondered what they were like. Unless you're too goddamned busy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAGE 105 BARBER No, no. That's fine. Let me heat up a towel. Walt hands Martin the Barber a twenty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's a twenty. Keep the change in case you slip and hit my jugular.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walt gets fitted for a new suit. The OLD TAILOR carefully measures Walt's shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you can take it in right here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir. Take about an hour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's great. Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never had a fitted suit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walt comes in and Father Janovich looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Kowalski, what can I do for you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've come for confession.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Lord Jesus, what have you done?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. Take it easy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you up to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAGE 106 WALT Are you going to let me confess or not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walt calmly sits on one side and a very nervous, sweating Father Janovich sits on the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long has it been since your last confession?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forever. Bless me, Father, for I have sinned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are your sins, my son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In 1968, I kissed Betty Jablonski at the work Christmas party. Dorothy was talking with the other wives and it just happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Go on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I made nine hundred dollars profit selling a boat and motor and never reported the taxes which is the same as stealing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And lastly, I was never close to my two sons. I don't know them. I didn't know how.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatta you mean, That's it?' It's bothered me for years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAGE 107 FATHER JANOVICH God loves and forgives you. Say ten Hail Marys' and five Our Fathers.' Are you going to retaliate for what happened to Sue? Walt says nothing. Father Janovich looks hard at Walt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going over to that house today, Mr. Kowalski.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that so?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is. And every other day until you see the folly in what you are planning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta go, Padre. Busy day ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go in peace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am at peace. Walt and Father Janovich shake hands. Walt exits. Father Janovich exhales loudly and drops into his chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Je -- zuz -- Christ.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walt carefully reassembles the two weapons he just cleaned and oiled. Tao comes in and looks down at the two weapons -- The 30-06 M1 GARAND RIFLE and the COLT .45 PISTOL. Tao picks up the heavy RIFLE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which one do I get?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ever fire a weapon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAGE 108 TAO No. Tao aims the rifle at an imaginary target.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put that down. I got something for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In Korea, October, 1952. We were sent up to sweep a Chink machine gun nest that had carved us up pretty bad. I was the only one who came back... I received the Silver Star. I want you to have it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When we went up that hill, we knew it was ten to one against us, but we went anyway. This trouble now, it's similar. We're walking right into it. We might not be coming home tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hell we won't. We're going to roll in there and tear ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be a fool, these guys are waiting for that exact reaction. Tao is quiet for a minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many men did you kill in Korea?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thirteen for sure. Probably more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAGE 109 TAO What was it like to kill a man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't want to know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go get the Silver Star. It's in a blue wooden box in the cellar. Tao goes downstairs. He turns on the light and goes into the cellar. Tao locates a BLUE WOODEN BOX and opens it. Tao holds up the MEDAL. He looks at it closely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walt slams the heavy cellar DOOR shut behind him. Walt slides the BOLT LOCK into place with a loud
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Tao couldn't kick his way out of there in ten years. Of course he tries anyway. Tao is furious. He throws things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell are you doing?! Let me out of here, you goddamned son- of-a-bitch!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quit smashing everything. You'll never get out of there, so just relax.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You let me out, you crazy old fuck, or I will kill you when I get out of here. Tao pounds on the door. Walt pounds back with a strength and authority which startles Tao.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to know how it feels to kill a man? It feels goddamned lousy. And it feels even worse when you get a medal for bravery right after you mowed down some scared kid when he tries to give up. A dumb, scared, little gook, just about your age. I shot him with the same rifle you just held upstairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've thought about that kid for fifty years. And I promise you, boy, you want no part of it. Me, I've got blood on my hands. I'm soiled. Forgive me for tricking you like a dope. I'll call someone and have them let you out later.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Let me out!! Tao pounds on the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've come a long way. I'm proud to call you a friend. You have your whole life ahead of you, whereas this is what I do. I finish things. You'd just get in the way. Sorry. Walt goes back upstairs, leaving Tao locked up in his cellar. Tao howls to be let out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walt walks out his front door with Daisy on her leash. He walks over to Tao's house. Phong sits in a lawnchair and glares at Walt. She yells in Hmong as Walt walks straight up to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, pipe down, you hag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're an evil man. I've seen your kind before. Back home, white soldiers came to our villages and filled our young men's minds with ideas of glory. Then you'd lead them away to their deaths. Walt, of course, has no idea what she said.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine, I hate you too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walt holds out the DOG LEASH to Phong. She looks down at Daisy and back at Walt. She lashes out again in Hmong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need you to watch my dog. Walt holds the leash closer. Phong folds her arms in defiance. Walt exhales loudly. Walt lifts up one of the LEGS OF HER LAWNCHAIR and slips the loop of the leash underneath it so Daisy can't follow him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her name is Daisy. Walt bends down on one knee and lovingly pets Daisy. He scratches her belly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You take it easy, old gal. You good old girl. Walt gets up and walks away without looking back. Phong is stunned; she is silent for once.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walt walks in and sits down. He nods to the regulars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good afternoon, gentlemen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter, how are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never been better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beer and a shot, Walt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I'll have something different. Walt looks at the liquor display. At the pinnacle of bottles sits a bottle of Johnnie Walker Blue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think I'll try that Johnnie Walker Blue Label.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAGE 112 The regulars all Oooooo and Ahhhhhhh at Walt's order.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatta ya win the lottery, Wally?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw, just having something special. Walt sips his Scotch and nods. It's good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you get all the guys the same.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure. This is too good not to be shared. Walt finishes his Scotch and points for one more. Several regulars hold up their drinks towards Walt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walt slips into the phone booth. He puts in change and dials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sue weakly answers the phone next to her bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) It's Walt. The key to my front door is under the ceramic turtle. Open the door and go let your brother out of the cellar. I have to go. The line goes dead as Walt hangs up. Sue jumps up out of bed, pulls on some clothes and runs downstairs. Phong blocks her path. Phong grabs Sue by the arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAGE 113 PHONG (SUBTITLED) Who was that? Where are you going? You tell me what's going on?! Sue squirms away from Phong and runs outside. On her way over to Walt's house, she sees Daisy leashed to Phong's chair. It scares Sue even more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father Janovich paces back and forth. The SQUAD CAR pulls up to him, which is exactly what he's been afraid of all day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, Father, we have to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm telling you. If we're not here, there will be bloodshed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've been here for hours. We can't afford to anchor a unit to one location.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm begging you to stay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just got word from my Sergeant, we're pulling the plug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm staying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No you aren't. My orders are specific. You came with us, you're leaving with us. Father Janovich looks hard at the duplex before getting into the SQUAD CAR. The SQUAD CAR drives off. Walt pulls up in front, gets out of his pickup and slams the door. He looks at the duplex. It's a total eyesore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a goddamned mess. You slopes should be ashamed of yourselves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAGE 114 Walt walks up the sidewalk and stops twenty feet from the duplex. Six very scared, very jittery Hmong gangbangers look out at Walt from various doorways and windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that all you swamp rats or is there more vermin scurrying in the shadows? Smokie and Spider step out and stand on the porch. Smokie smiles at Walt. Walt spits on the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wasn't sure that you'd...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up, gook. I'm not here to listen to one goddamned syllable of what a shrimp-dicked little baby midget like you has to say. Spider pulls his PISTOL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right, boy. Defend your boyfriend after he or you or whoever rapes a member of your family. Your own blood, for Christ's sake. Go ahead, pull your pistols, just like a bunch of ridiculous miniature toy cowboys. Smokie and several other Hmong gangbangers pull their guns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have no honor. You're the scum of the earth and when you're gone, do you think anyone will care? No one will mourn. You won't be missed. All the Hmong are spooked at Walt's absolute lack of fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Tao, old man? He too scared to come and stick up for himself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAGE 115 WALT No. Tao is too good for this. You pukes aren't worth one second of his time. Walt slowly puts a CIGARETTE in his mouth. Even this slight movement has the gangbangers waving their PISTOLS around. Walt laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You boys are a little bit jumpy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You watch it, old man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I think you'd better watch it. Walt looks around. Other than the gangbangers, a small group of people have gathered to watch this showdown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sue opens the front door, runs to the stairwell and pounds down the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tao? Tao, are you alright?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! LET ME OUT!! She unlocks the CELLAR DOOR. Tao comes out in a rage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddamn it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He left without me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where? Where'd he go?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He went to Smokie's without me. Tao takes the stairs two steps at a time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAGE 116 SUE No! No, Tao! Sue grabs Tao's legs and hangs on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Don't you dare! Stay away from them, Tao! I don't want anyone else getting hurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave me alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NO! They struggle at the top of the stairs and spill into the kitchen floor. Tao runs for the door when something catches his eye... The kitchen table. The RIFLE and PISTOL are still there. Walt purposely left the guns at home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God! NO!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anybody got a light? No? I got one. Walt's slight grin fades. He mutters to himself...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hail Mary, full of grace. Walt reaches into his coat pocket. Six Hmong gangbangers simultaneously level their PISTOLS and FIRE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Walt is struck down. People scream. Walt falls dead. A ZIPPO lighter clutched in his hand. Walt never intended to kill anyone. Self-sacrifice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SMOKIE'S DUPLEX - LATER 109 109 Tao and Sue arrive just as Smokie, Spider and company are being driven away in Police cars. Tao looks at Smokie in the squad car. Smokie no longer looks tough or hard, he just looks scared. On the street, Walt is being bagged by the ambulance crew. Father Janovich prays over him. Tao steps up to a POLICE OFFICER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to step back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was a friend of mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said step back. Tao turns to the HMONG POLICE OFFICER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened, man? The Hmong Police Officer looks at the WHITE POLICE OFFICER and then to Tao.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard him, step back. Tao speaks to the HMONG OFFICER in their native language.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, man, it's important. He's my friend. Tell me what happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The old guy reaches for a lighter and they gunned him down. The gang said the old guy was here to kill them, but he didn't have a weapon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going to happen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We actually have witnesses for once. These guys are going away big time. The WHITE OFFICER yells at the HMONG OFFICER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Officer Chang, get those people back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir. You have to step back now. Tao hugs his sister. Sue openly weeps. Tao holds it in. He looks at his friend Walt as the bag is zipped over him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tao and Sue wait in front. Tao wears a suit, Sue is in a traditional Hmong dress. A TAXI pulls up and they get in. Sitting on the porch is Phong who rocks back and forth in her rocking chair. Phong holds Daisy in her arms, gently petting the old dog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're at the funeral of Walter Kowalski. Walt is dressed in his new suit. Along with the crowd you'd expect, Tao and Sue are seated near the front. Walt's sons and family are there. Mitch gives Tao a dirty look. Tao looks back at him, his gaze bores right through Mitch. Mitch looks away. Father Janovich steps up to the pulpit and speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAGE 119 FATHER JANOVICH Walt Kowalski once said to me I didn't know anything about life or death because I was an overeducated, 27-year-old virgin who held the hands of superstitious old women and promised them eternity.' Walt definitely had no problem calling it like he saw it.' But Walt was right. I knew really nothing about life or death until I got to know Walt. And boy, did I learn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All of Walt's family are seated in an office as a LAWYER reads Walt Kowalski's will. Tao is present along with Walt's family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which brings us to our last item. And again, please forgive the language used in Mr. Kowalski's will. I'm simply reading it as it was written. The LAWYER takes a sip of water before reading...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And to my friend, Tao Vang Lor, I leave my 1972 Gran Torino on the condition that you don't choptop the roof like a damned spick, don't paint any idiotic flames on it like some white-trash hillbilly and don't put a big gay spoiler on the rear-end like you see on all the other zipper heads' cars. It just looks like hell. If you can refrain from doing any of that, it's yours.
direction.name: direction
